subject: Physical Fitness
title: Sleep and Cognitive Performance
description: A fast breakdown of Sleep and Cognitive Performance for builders.

hook.text: After 24 hours without sleep, your cognitive impairment equals a blood alcohol level of 0.10%. Legally drunk.

buildup.text: Sleep consolidates motor skills. Athletes who sleep well perform practiced movements more accurately.

discovery.text: The brain replays motor patterns during sleep, strengthening neural pathways without physical practice.

twist.text: A nap after learning a new skill improves performance more than additional practice without sleep.

climax.text: Sleep isn't downtime for the brain. It's active processing â€” filing memories and refining movement programs.

punchline.text: Your brain practices while you sleep. Rest is part of the training.
